52 #ifdef __ICCARM__
53 /*
54 * IAR MISRA C 2004 error suppressions.
55 *
56 * Pm073 (rule 14.7): a function should have a single point of exit.
57 * Pm143 (rule 14.7): a function should have a single point of exit at the end of the function.
58 * Multiple returns are used for error handling.
59 *
60 * Pm140 (rule 11.3): a cast should not be performed between a pointer type and an integral type
61 * The rule makes an exception for memory-mapped register accesses.
62 */
63 #pragma diag_suppress=Pm073,Pm143,Pm140
64 #endif /* __ICCARM__ */

108 const ADI_ADUCM302X_SECURITY_OPTIONS adi_aducm302x_security_options

113  0xFFFFFFFFu,
114  0xFFFFFFFFu,

125 uint32_t SystemCoreClock = 0u;
126 
127 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
128  Clock functions
129  *----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
130 
139  void SystemCoreClockUpdate(void)
140 {
141  uint32_t val, nDivisor, nMulfactor, div2, mul2;
142 
143 #ifdef ADI_DEBUG
144  /* "lfclock" is only used during debug checks... */
145  /* LF clock is always 32k, whether osc or xtal */
146  lfClock = __LFCLK; /* for beep, wdt and lcd */
147  if (lfClock == 0u)
148  {
149  while (1) {}
150  }
151 #endif
152  /* Update Core Clock sources */
153  /* update the HF clock */
154  switch (pADI_CLKG0_CLK->CTL0 & BITM_CLKG_CLK_CTL0_CLKMUX ) {
155 
156  case HFMUX_INTERNAL_OSC_VAL:
157  hfClock = __HFOSC;
158  break;
159 
160  case HFMUX_EXTERNAL_XTAL_VAL:
161  hfClock = __HFXTAL;
162  break;
163 
164  case HFMUX_SYSTEM_SPLL_VAL:
165  /* Calculate System PLL output frequency */
166  if ((pADI_CLKG0_CLK->CTL0 & BITM_CLKG_CLK_CTL0_SPLLIPSEL) != 0u) {
167  /* PLL input from HFXTAL */
168  val = __HFXTAL;
169  } else {
170  /* PLL input from HFOSC */
171  val = __HFOSC;
172  }
173 
174  /* PLL NSEL multiplier */
175  nMulfactor = (pADI_CLKG0_CLK->CTL3 & BITM_CLKG_CLK_CTL3_SPLLNSEL) >> BITP_CLKG_CLK_CTL3_SPLLNSEL;
176  /* PLL MSEL divider */
177  nDivisor = (pADI_CLKG0_CLK->CTL3 & BITM_CLKG_CLK_CTL3_SPLLMSEL) >> BITP_CLKG_CLK_CTL3_SPLLMSEL;
178 
179  /* PLL NSEL multiplier */
180  mul2 = (pADI_CLKG0_CLK->CTL3 & BITM_CLKG_CLK_CTL3_SPLLMUL2) >> BITP_CLKG_CLK_CTL3_SPLLMUL2;
181  /* PLL MSEL divider */
182  div2 = (pADI_CLKG0_CLK->CTL3 & BITM_CLKG_CLK_CTL3_SPLLDIV2) >> BITP_CLKG_CLK_CTL3_SPLLDIV2;
183 
184  val = ((val << mul2) * nMulfactor / nDivisor) >> div2;
185 
186  hfClock = val;
187  break;
188 
189  case HFMUX_GPIO_VAL:
190  hfClock = gpioClock;
191  break;
192 
193  default:
194  return;
195  } /* end switch */
196 
197  SystemCoreClock = hfClock;
198  }
199 
200 #ifdef __ARMCC_VERSION
201 /* We want a warning if semi-hosting libraries are used. */
202 #pragma import(__use_no_semihosting_swi)
203 #endif
204 
213 void SystemInit (void)
214 {
215  uint32_t IntStatus;
216 
217  /* Enable Bank0 and 1 SRAM retention. */
218  adi_system_EnableRetention(adi_system_EnableRetention(ADI_SRAM_BANK_1 | ADI_SRAM_BANK_2, true);
219 
220 /* To disable the instruction SRAM and entire 64K of SRAM is used as DSRAM. */
221 #ifdef ADI_DISABLE_INSTRUCTION_SRAM
222  adi_system_EnableISRAM(false);
223 #endif
224 
225  /* To enable the instruction cache. */
226 #ifdef ENABLE_CACHE
227  adi_system_EnableCache(true);
228 #endif
229 
230  /* Because SystemInit must not use global variables, the following
231  * interrupt disabling code should not be replaced with critical region
232  * code which uses global variables.
233  */
234  IntStatus = __get_PRIMASK();
235  __disable_irq();
236 
237  /* Set the vector table address */
238  SCB->VTOR = (uint32_t) &__Vectors;
239 
240  /* Set all three (USGFAULTENA, BUSFAULTENA, and MEMFAULTENA) fault enable bits
241  * in the System Control Block, System Handler Control and State Register
242  * otherwise these faults are handled as hard faults.
243  */
244  SCB->SHCSR = SCB_SHCSR_USGFAULTENA_Msk |
245  SCB_SHCSR_BUSFAULTENA_Msk |
246  SCB_SHCSR_MEMFAULTENA_Msk ;
247 
248  /* Flush instruction and data pipelines to insure assertion of new settings. */
249  __ISB();
250  __DSB();
251 
252  __set_PRIMASK(IntStatus);
253 }
254 
265 void adi_system_EnableCache(bool bEnable)
266 {
267  pADI_FLCC0_CACHE->KEY = CACHE_CONTROLLER_KEY;
268 
269  if(bEnable == true)
270  {
271  pADI_FLCC0_CACHE->SETUP |= BITM_FLCC_CACHE_SETUP_ICEN;
272  }
273  else
274  {
275  pADI_FLCC0_CACHE->SETUP &= ~BITM_FLCC_CACHE_SETUP_ICEN;
276  }
277 }
278 
290 void adi_system_EnableISRAM(bool bEnable)
291 {
292  if(bEnable == true)
293  {
294  pADI_PMG0_TST->SRAM_CTL |= BITM_PMG_TST_SRAM_CTL_INSTREN;
295  }
296  else
297  {
298  pADI_PMG0_TST->SRAM_CTL &= ~BITM_PMG_TST_SRAM_CTL_INSTREN;
299  }
300 }
301 
315 uint32_t adi_system_EnableRetention(ADI_SRAM_BANK eBank, bool bEnable)
316 {
317 #ifdef ADI_DEBUG
318  if((eBank != ADI_SRAM_BANK_1) && (eBank != ADI_SRAM_BANK_2))
319  {
320  return 1u;
321  }
322 
323 #endif
324  pADI_PMG0->PWRKEY = PWRKEY_VALUE_KEY;
325  if(bEnable == true)
326  {
327  pADI_PMG0->SRAMRET |= (uint32_t)eBank>>1;
328  }
329  else
330  {
331  pADI_PMG0->SRAMRET &= ~((uint32_t)eBank >> 1);
332  }
333 
334  return 0u;
335 }
